Unfortunately, this card just really doesn't work without a lot of very hard to find support. Moving around the ghostflames in the traditional way (meeting their condition and waiting until the next turn) doesn't work due to the timing of speedrunning. If that issue could be fixed, the card would be much more generally useable (I really don't see why it can't give 2 strength at the start of the next turn instead). Right now, you would have to pair it with several advance cards to get any effect at all, which makes for an underwhelming and difficult to use power. Hexaghost also just doesn't scale that well with strength (incineration adn time warp at rare, strike from beyond at common,  rain of embers at uncommon), which makes temporary strength a pretty weak reward from this power. You will also frequently be using soulburn as a primary source of damge, and that doesn't scale with strength at all. You can keep the strength with orange pellets, or gain some temp hp with impeccable pecs, but that won't come up that often.

There are just far more powerful and consistent options available for damage scaling (many soulburn related) on hexaghost, and so you will rarely be incentivized to take this. It's awful into all the act 1 elites, and is too low impact/unreliable for act 2 elites and hallway fights. I can't think of anytime you are supposed to take this card other than already having orange pellets, and lacking in damage scaling. The upgrade is really bad too, I can't think of many cards I would want less on turn 1 of a fight where I usually need to setup/block or deal frontloaded damage. On some level, I believe this card just needs a complete redesign
